New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a single season.
Ohtani is the first player in major-league history to slug three home runs and steal two bases in a game.
Ohtani matched Shawn Green’s single-season franchise record of 49 home runs set in 2001.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani finished 6-for-6 with 10 RBIs in a 20-4 victory over the Miami Marlins.
Ohtani hit his 50th home run into the Recess Sports Lounge in left field at loanDepot Park.
Ohtani added a home run off of position player Vidal Brujan in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Ohtani expressed relief after achieving the 50-50 milestone.
Mookie Betts commented on Ohtani's confidence and performance.
Gavin Lux and Teoscar Hernández praised Ohtani's achievements.
Miguel Rojas shared his emotional reaction to witnessing Ohtani's historic performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers celebrated their 12th consecutive postseason berth with a muted celebration.
Ohtani's performance helped the Dodgers clinch a postseason spot.
